application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use from Commercial, Business and Service (Use Class E) to Dwellinghouses (Use Class C3)
decision_conditions: Development must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the prior approval date.
Reason: In accordance with Condition MA.2. (5) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended).

| Any building permitted to be used as a dwellinghouse by virtue of Class MA is to remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 1 to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.
Reason: In accordance with Condition MA.2. (6) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing and supporting document(s): Site Location Plan; 1415-1 Rev A (Existing Plans); 1415-2 Rev C (Proposed Plans); Internal Daylight and Sunlight Assessment by Elmstead Energy Assessments & Building Services dated 04.07.2024; Cover Letter.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays, in accordance with internal noise limits specified in BS8233:2014, including the aircraft noise data in Section 6, SPG10 (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB). Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Best practicable mitigation measures shall also be implemented, as necessary, in external amenity spaces to achieve criteria of BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7A and 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom/bedspace below/above kitchen/ living/ dining/ bathroom/ circulation space of separate premises and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedroom adjoining the main entrance and staircase to upstairs premises. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7A and 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of commercial noise sources at the development site/neighbouring properties and their noise levels. Enhanced sound insulation value of at least 10dB/15/20dB, as necessary above the Building Regulations value for residential use, shall be provided to the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating commercial premises and mechanical installations from dwellings. The characteristics of any commercial noise source shall not exceed a Noise Rating level of NR20 Leq 5mins (octaves) inside habitable rooms. Details shall include the installation method and materials of separating structures and any additional mitigation measures, together with the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound level within dwellings. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7A and 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The cycle storage shown in the approved drawings listed under condition 3 shall be brought into use prior to first occupation of the flat and retained permanently for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To ensure adequate cycle storage, in accordance with Policy T6 of the London Plan (2021).

| The refuse storage shown in the approved drawings listed under condition 3 shall be brought into use prior to first occupation of the flat and retained permanently for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To ensure adequate refuse storage, in accordance with Policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Change of use of ground floor from computer repair shop to one studio flat (Use Class C3) (Class MA, 56 Day Prior Approval Process)
